channel.title: Smoking
channel.description: What are your views on smoking? Do you think it helps people after a stressful day or you think "No it's addicting and ill die from diseases." Personally I think it helps alot of stressed out people AT THE TIME. Later in their future it is still ruining your life-span and destroying your life. How do you feel?

item.title: Smoking
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Broken Britain:

I stated that it was still bad for you, not that it was any less. I find most people who smoke it to be in denial.

Almost all new smokers go through that pot activist phase, immediately disreputing any associated health problems. I was like that and probably still am Part of the reason for this is all the misinformation out there. The ‘health problems’ are often grossly exaggerated or downright false especially by the schools etc, than you start to question anything they say about it. But I would never call it harmless or say it’s free of problems.

[quote=“Broken Britain, post:125, topic:462075”]http://alcoholism.about.com/od/pot/a/effects.-Lya.htm

[quote]
marijuana smoke contains three times the amount of tar found in tobacco smoke
[/quote][/quote]

It’s hard to come up with a real number for this. Studies in the past have used parts from the entire plant, when you actually only smoke the flowers (buds). When only the buds were studied, It was found that marijuana has 33% of the tar found in tobacco. But then you need to consider that marijuana is usually smoked unfiltered and is often held in longer.

To put this into perspective, since your study compares it with tobacco, also consider that tobacco smokers smoke around a pack a day, which is 25 cigs. Compare that to a guy who smokes 1 joint every 3 weeks or whatever. A significantly less amount of tar is being inhaled even for a guy who smokes weed every single day.

But in my opinion, tar isn’t even the real problem. Since 90% of smoking-related cancer is not caused by tar or carcinogens, but rather radioactive components lead 210 and polonium 210, not found in marijuana. Infact, there has never been a documented case of any lung/throat/any cancer being attributed to marijuana alone. Studies have failed to find evidence that marijuana causes any respiratory dysfunction or disease. Newer findings suggest that it kills aging and mutating cells, preventing cancer.

Broken Britain:

Sure there is. You would still get all the long term mental issues.

This is a touchy subject, as not even a doctor will tell a druggie that his schizophrenia was a result of his drug use. It’s well known that you should stay away from pot and other drugs if you have mental problems. And unfortunately some people have underlying issues that they don’t even know about. It’s said drugs could bring out these problems. There is no real evidence to show that marijuana will directly cause mental health problems.

Fails:

gateway drug.

This is bullcrap. You are in control of your life. If you start harder drugs, you only have yourself to blame. If you insist pot is a gateway drug, than so is alcohol, and so is coffee. Most people probably try alcohol before trying marijauna.

I didn’t post my sources as I’ve been through this too many times on this forum

Read full topic

item.title: Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:121, topic:462075”][quote author=Broken Britain link=topic=565029.msg4115302#msg4115302 date=1348987255]

Cigarettes, no. disgusting.

marijuana, yes and no. yes, its relaxing and is medically beneficial. not to mention, hilariously fun. BUT in the end, getting busted for it, is not worth what you get out of it. getting high isn’t worth the chance you take.

Marijuana is still bad for you, health wise, in many aspects.
[/quote]

arguably less so than tobacco[/quote]
Only risk is the risks from breathing in anything that isn’t air.

Fails:

gateway drug.

Only for high junkies who want bigger and badder.

Read full topic

item.title: Smoking
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Broken Britain, post:125, topic:462075”]http://alcoholism.about.com/od/pot/a/effects.-Lya.htm

[quote]
marijuana smoke contains three times the amount of tar found in tobacco smoke
[/quote][/quote]

the study that suggests one joint of cannabis is equivalent to 20 cigarettes is a bad study, it looked at a joint rolled of the whole plant that wouldn’t otherwise be smoked

but the idea that “marijuana is bad for you” stems from the idea you’d be smoking it, if baked into brownies and ate for example there’s not necessarily any negative health effects

Read full topic

item.title: Smoking
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Verywell Mind

The Numerous Negative Health Effects of Marijuana

Although activists believe smoking pot has no negative effects, scientific research indicates that marijuana use can cause many health problems.

marijuana smoke contains three times the amount of tar found in tobacco smoke

I’m not here to persuade anyone about anything, there may be some positives but there are also negatives. Anyone can do a quick Google search so find the evidence yourself.

There’s one link to some negativity of marijuana. I wouldn’t consider it evidence though because I don’t know the source, the same as I wouldn’t consider the people who smoke it telling me it is good for you evidence.

Read full topic
